intro: Androsace adfinis subsp. puberula, commonly known as the pubescent androsace, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, hairy leaves that are typically covered in fine pubescence, giving it a soft, velvety appearance. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with five petals and a showy, clustered arrangement. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in alpine or subalpine habitats.
